article.title: Information Retrieval On-Line
article.author: Lancaster, F.W.
article.text: This book deals with on-line systems for bibliographic search and retrieval. The literature on this subject is increasing rapidly and new systems are appearing all the time. We have attempted to provide a broad survey of the characteristics, capabilities, and limitations of present systems. Our emphasis is on the design, evaluation, and use of on-line retrieval systems, primarily from the viewpoint of the planner and manager of information services. It is oriented toward the "intellectual" aspects of information retrieval rather than the hardware or programming aspects. We hope that this book may have some value for all students of library and information science.
